meta.title: Grants-Cibola County Schools School District (2020) | Bluewater, NM

meta.name: description
meta.content: View the 2020 directory of the top 11 public schools in Grants-Cibola County Schools School District. Find rankings, test scores, reviews and more. Read about great schools like: Grants High School, Mesa View Elementary School and Seboyeta Elementary School.

span.title: item which has been noted, verified.

div.div: For the 2020 school year, there are 11 top public schools in Grants-Cibola County Schools School District, serving 3,525 students.

span.title: item which has been noted, verified.

div.div: Public school in Grants-Cibola County School School District have an average math proficiency score of 13% (versus New Mexico public school average of 20%), and reading proficiency score of 24% (versus 29% New Mexico statewide average). This district's average school ranking is in the bottom 50% of public schools in New Mexico.

span.title: item which has been noted, verified.

div.div: The school with the highest math and reading proficiency is Bluewater Elementary School, with 60-64% math proficiency and 50-54% reading proficiency. Read more about public school math/reading proficiency statistics in New Mexico or national school math/reading proficiency statistics.

span.title: item which has been noted, verified.

div.div: Minority enrollment is 86% of the student body (majority American Indian) , which is more than the New Mexico public school average of 77% (majority Hispanic).

span.title: item which has been noted, verified.

div.div: The student:teacher ratio of 14:1 is less than the New Mexico public school average of 16:1.

Grants-Cibola County Schools School District, which is ranked within the bottom 50% of all 145 school districts in New Mexico (based off of combined Math and Reading proficiency testing data) for the 2016-2017 school year.
The school district's graduation rate of 48% has decreased from 71% over five school years.

% of Two or more races Students

div.div: The revenue/student of $10,844 in this school district is less than the state average of $15,571. The school district revenue/student has stayed relatively flat over four school years.
The school district's spending/student of $10,808 is less than the state average of $17,012. The school district spending/student has stayed relatively flat over four school years.
